title.narrative: Integral acompaniment to victims in peace accord implementation

description.narrative: Legal actions presented at national and international level (Inter-American system of human rights). Support victims to defend their cases. Support the establishment of mechanisms for victims to engage in the peace accords implementation. Support the facilitation of public hearings as a mechanism for reporting and monitoring illegal actions. Provide integral support to communities, including legal support, advocacy, psycho-social support, educational programmes, leadership and human rights training, protection, technical support on environmental and agricultural aspects and accompaniment to help them protect and gain access to and control over land. Evaluate with communities how best to adapt humanitarian zones and humanitarian spaces to new context (possible ending of internal armed conflict). Provide integral support to communities, including legal support, advocacy, psycho-social support, educational programmes, leadership and human rights training, protection, technical support on environmental and agricultural aspects and accompaniment to help them protect and gain access to and control over land. Prepare and facilitate Dipaz and Conpaz members to undertake a leading role in the transitional justice mechanisms.

State institutions have become more accountable to civil society, communities, victims and partners. At least half of the 30 Communities, supported by the partner, have protected, gained access to and control over land in Meta, Valle de Cauca, Choco, Antioquia, Atlántico, Putumayo and Cauca. 30 Communities in Meta, Valle de Cauca, Choco, Antioquia, Atlántico, Putumayo and Cauca are resilient to threats of violence and are tackling the causes of violence, in particular impunity. Civil society and in particular Dipaz and Conpaz are able to influence the peace process and take part in the implementation of the peace accords in the aforementioned regions, ensuring victims´ rights to truth, justice, reparation and guarantees of non-repetition. Women in the communities are challenging negative gender norms, gaining access to and control over assets and resources, and playing a more prominent role in shaping the future of their communities.
